definitions: To write or name the letters that form (a word) in correct order.
To constitute the letters of (a word).
To have as a necessary consequence; result in.
To take the place of (someone) for a period of time; relieve.
To work for a period of time, relieving others.
examples: Can you spell your name for me?
This decision could spell disaster for the company.
I'll spell you at the wheel for a while.
They took turns spelling each other during the long shift.
